item.title: 吉利德公司宣布在美国新投资 110 亿美元
item.description: 吉利德科学公司（Gilead Sciences）周三宣布，将在美国进行 110 亿美元的资本和运营投资，以补充已计划在 2030 年前用于国内生产和研发的 210 亿美元支出。【原文：Gilead Sciences on Wednesday announced $11 billion in capital and operational investments in the U.S. to supplement an already planned spending of $21 billion in domestic manufacturing and R&D through 2030.】

item.title: 华盛顿邮报》报道：美国推动面临关税的国家批准马斯克的 "星链 "计划
item.description: 华盛顿邮报》周三援引美国国务院的电报报道称，美国已推动一些面临唐纳德-特朗普总统加征关税的国家批准埃隆-马斯克的 "星链 "计划。【原文：The United States has pushed some nations facing tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump to approve Elon Musk's Starlink, the Washington Post reported on Wednesday, citing State Department cables.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称卡塔尔资助叙利亚军饷获美国批准
item.description: 三位消息人士称，美国为卡塔尔资助叙利亚公共部门工资的倡议开绿灯【原文：U.S. GREENLIGHTS QATARI INITIATIVE TO FINANCE SYRIAN PUBLIC-SECTOR SALARIES, THREE SOURCES SAY】

item.title: 特朗普表示美国可能放宽对部分海湾国家的芯片出口限制
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周三表示，他将很快宣布美国是否会放宽对一些海湾国家的芯片出口限制。【原文：President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he will soon have an announcement on whether the U.S. will ease microchip export restrictions to some Gulf countries.】

item.title: VIEW 美联储按兵不动，但认为通胀和经济增长风险加大
item.description: 美联储周三维持利率稳定，但表示通胀和失业率上升的风险已经上升，这进一步给经济前景蒙上了阴影，因为美国央行正在努力应对特朗普政府关税政策的影响。【原文：The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady on Wednesday but said the risks of both higher inflation and unemployment had risen, further clouding the economic outlook as the U.S. central bank grapples with the impact of Trump administration tariff policies.】

item.title: 据《日经新闻》报道，日本电报公司考虑以 209 亿美元收购 NTT Data 剩余股份
item.description: 据《日经新闻》（Nikkei）周三晚些时候报道，日本电信巨头日本电信电话公司（Nippon Telegraph and Telephone）正在考虑提出高达 3 万亿日元（约合 209.2 亿美元）的要约收购，以购买其尚未持有的 NTT Data 剩余股份，但未透露消息来源。【原文：Japan's telecom giant Nippon Telegraph and Telephone is considering to make a tender offer of up to 3 trillion yen ($20.92 billion) to buy the remaining shares it does not already own in NTT Data, the Nikkei reported late on Wednesday without naming the source.】

item.title: Cadence推出基于Nvidia的新型超级计算机，进军工程和生物技术软件领域
item.description: 凯登斯设计系统公司（Cadence Design Systems）周三发布了一台基于英伟达（Nvidia）芯片的新型超级计算机，这将加快其软件产品的速度，从设计芯片、喷气机到新药，无所不包。【原文：Cadence Design Systems unveiled on Wednesday a new supercomputer based on chips from Nvidia that will speed up its software offerings for everything from designing chips to jets to new drugs.】

item.title: 美国航空公司首席执行官支持特朗普政府的空中交通管制改革计划
item.description: 官员们表示，美国五大航空公司的首席执行官周四计划支持特朗普政府斥资数百亿美元改革老化的空中交通管制系统并增加招聘的提议。【原文：The CEOs of the five largest U.S. airlines on Thursday plan to back the Trump administration's proposal to spend tens of billions of dollars to reform the aging air traffic control system and boost hiring, officials said.】

item.title: 关税给美国前景蒙上阴影，米尔肯公司的投资者将目光投向海外市场
item.description: 本周在洛杉矶举行的一次投资者聚会上，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普反复无常的决策和咄咄逼人的关税立场给市场带来了巨大的不确定性，许多人表示，现在是时候转向非美国资产以寻求更多的明确性了。【原文：Market uncertainty caused by U.S. President Donald Trump's erratic policymaking and aggressive stance on tariffs hung heavily over an investor gathering in Los Angeles this week, with many saying it is time to pivot to non-U.S. assets for more clarity.】

item.title: 微软赢得美国联邦贸易委员会上诉，挑战动视暴雪 690 亿美元交易
item.description: 美国联邦上诉法院周三驳回了美国联邦贸易委员会对微软以 690 亿美元收购《使命召唤》制造商动视暴雪公司（Activision Blizzard）提出的法律挑战。【原文：A federal appeals court on Wednesday rejected a legal challenge by the U.S. Federal Trade Commission to Microsoft's $69 billion purchase of “Call of Duty” maker Activision Blizzard.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，苹果希望在 Safari 中添加人工智能搜索功能，这可能会对谷歌造成打击
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三报道，苹果公司正在 "积极考虑 "重塑其设备上的 Safari 网页浏览器，将重点放在人工智能搜索引擎上，此举可能会削弱谷歌在利润丰厚的搜索市场上的主导地位。【原文：Apple is "actively looking at" reshaping the Safari web browser on its devices to focus on AI-powered search engines, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, a move that could chip away at Google's dominance in the lucrative search market.】

item.title: Dayforce 第二季度营收低于预期，原因是支出减少
item.description: 人力资源软件供应商 Dayforce 周三预测第二季度营收低于市场预期，预计在宏观经济不确定的情况下，薪资和人力资源服务支出将减少。【原文：Human resources software provider Dayforce on Wednesday forecast second-quarter revenue below market estimates, anticipating reduced spending on its payroll and HR services amid macroeconomic uncertainty.】

item.title: 空中客车公司四月份交付量下降 8
item.description: 空中客车公司周三表示，4月份交付了56架飞机，比去年同期下降了8%。【原文：Airbus said on Wednesday it delivered 56 aircraft in April, down 8% from the same month of last year.】

item.title: 工会称，Stellantis 将通过自愿离职的方式在意大利梅尔菲工厂裁员多达 500 人
item.description: Fiom-Cgil 工会周三在一份声明中表示，汽车制造商 Stellantis 将通过自愿离职的方式在其位于意大利南部的梅尔菲（Melfi）装配厂裁减多达 500 个工作岗位，该厂拥有约 5000 名员工。【原文：Carmaker Stellantis will cut up to 500 jobs through voluntary exits at its Melfi assembly plant in southern Italy, which employs around 5,000 people, the Fiom-Cgil union said on Wednesday in a statement.】

item.title: 谷歌发现与俄罗斯黑客组织有关的新型恶意软件
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司周三表示，它已识别出一种名为 "LOSTKEYS "的新型恶意软件，该恶意软件与俄罗斯政府支持的威胁组织 Cold River 有关，能够窃取文件并向攻击者发送系统信息。【原文：Alphabet's Google said on Wednesday it has identified a new malware called "LOSTKEYS" tied to the Russian government-backed threat group Cold River, which is capable of stealing files and sending system information to attackers.】

item.title: 法国初创企业 Mistral 推出企业聊天机器人，100 天内收入翻了三倍
item.description: Mistral AI 公司首席执行官说，这家法国初创公司在过去 100 天内的收入增加了两倍，尤其是来自美国以外地区的需求。【原文：Mistral AI on Wednesday launched its Le Chat chatbot for corporate use, and its CEO said the French startup has tripled its revenue in the last 100 days, with demand coming particularly from outside the United States.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Grab 希望在第二季度达成收购印度尼西亚 GoTo 公司的交易
item.description: 两位知情人士透露，在美国上市的叫车和送餐公司 Grab 正寻求在第二季度达成收购规模较小的印尼竞争对手 GoTo 的交易。【原文：U.S.-listed ride-hailing and food delivery company Grab is looking to strike a deal to take over smaller Indonesian rival GoTo in the second quarter, two sources with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 欧盟将于周四制定针对美国关税的下一步反制措施
item.description: 欧盟贸易委员马罗斯-塞夫科维奇（Maros Sefcovic）周三表示，如果与华盛顿的谈判失败，欧盟委员会将于周四宣布下一步针对美国关税的反制措施细节。【原文：The European Commission will announce on Thursday details of its next countermeasures against U.S. tariffs should negotiations with Washington fail, European Trade Commissioner Maros Sefcovic said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 因硬件和软件需求，CDW 季度业绩超出预期
item.description: 受医疗保健、教育和其他行业稳定需求的推动，IT 硬件和服务分销商 CDW 周三公布的第一季度收入和利润均超过华尔街预期。【原文：IT hardware and services distributor CDW topped Wall Street estimates for first-quarter revenue and profit on Wednesday, buoyed by steady demand from healthcare, education and other industries.】

item.title: 力拓与铟公司合作首次提取出镓
item.description: 矿业公司力拓（Rio Tinto）周三表示，作为与铟公司（Indium Corp）合作的一部分，该公司已经提取了第一批原生镓，其目的是生产出商业数量的这种矿物。【原文：Miner Rio Tinto , said on Wednesday it has extracted its first primary gallium as part of a collaboration with Indium Corp, which aims to produce commercial quantities of the mineral.】

item.title: 报刊报道：中国比亚迪和青山集团取消智利锂电厂计划
item.description: 据《金融日报》（Diario Financiero）周三报道，中国汽车制造商比亚迪（BYD）和金属集团青山（Tsingshan）均已通知智利当局，撤回在智利建设锂加工厂的计划。【原文：Chinese automaker BYD and metals group Tsingshan have both informed Chilean authorities that they are withdrawing plans to construct lithium processing plants in Chile, newspaper Diario Financiero reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 智利 Codelco 公司签署 5 亿美元保险公司支持信贷协议
item.description: 全球最大的铜生产商智利国有矿业公司 Codelco (COBRE.UL) 周三表示，该公司通过西班牙桑坦德银行签署了一项 5 亿美元的信贷协议，并由意大利国家信贷保险机构 SACE 提供担保。【原文：Chile's state-owned miner Codelco (COBRE.UL), the world's largest copper producer, said on Wednesday it signed a credit agreement for $500 million through Spanish lender Santander and with a guarantee from Italian state credit insurance agency SACE.】

item.title: 巴里克首席执行官称马里矿场每月耗资 1,500 万美元
item.description: 巴里克公司首席执行官马克-布里斯托（Mark Bristow）说，该公司每月要花费1500万美元来维持马里矿场的运转，他不知道政府把从该公司没收的黄金存放在哪里。【原文：Barrick CEO Mark Bristow said the miner is spending $15 million a month to keep its Mali mine running, and that he does not know where the government is keeping the gold that it confiscated from the company.】

item.title: 亚马逊将斥资 40 亿美元在智利建设云基础设施
item.description: 亚马逊南拉丁美洲负责人告诉路透社，该公司的云计算部门将投资 40 亿美元，在智利建设首个数据中心和其他云基础设施。【原文：Amazon's cloud computing division will invest $4 billion to build its first data centers and other cloud infrastructure in Chile, the company's head of South Latin America told Reuters.】

item.title: 蒂森克虏伯钢铁部门与工会就重组达成总协议
item.description: 蒂森克虏伯钢铁部门周三表示，已与 IG Metall 工会就德国最大钢铁制造商的重组计划达成原则性协议，并表示其目标是避免强制裁员。【原文：Thyssenkrupp's steel unit said on Wednesday that it has reached an agreement in principle with the IG Metall union around the planned restructuring of Germany's largest steel maker, adding its aim was to avoid forced layoffs.】

item.title: 美国关税和欧洲经济放缓重塑全球太阳能电池板贸易
item.description: 贸易数据显示，在包括柬埔寨和泰国在内的其他东南亚国家的出口受到大幅关税打击后，老挝和印度尼西亚的太阳能电池板制造商（大部分为中国企业所有）提高了它们在美国市场的份额。【原文：Solar panel makers in Laos and Indonesia, mostly owned by Chinese firms, boosted their share in the U.S. market after steep tariffs hit exports from other Southeast Asian countries including Cambodia and Thailand, trade data showed.】

item.title: 汇丰银行为美国客户启动特朗普关税支付程序
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）于4月2日征收全面关税，引起了包括中国在内的其他国家的报复，汇丰银行为美国客户推出了一项新的融资工具，用于支付进口关税。【原文：HSBC has launched a new financing tool for U.S. clients to pay import duties following the imposition of sweeping tariffs by President Donald Trump on April 2, which drew retaliation from other countries including China.】

item.title: EA 因乐观预测和《战地》发布而股价大涨
item.description: 电子艺界（Electronic Arts）的股票在盘前交易中上涨了近 5%，此前这家游戏巨头的乐观预测缓解了市场对其发展势头放缓的担忧，并恢复了人们对其体育大片的信心。【原文：Shares of Electronic Arts rose nearly 5% in premarket trading, after the gaming giant's upbeat forecast eased concerns about slowing momentum and revived confidence in its blockbuster sports titles.】

item.title: 数据分析产品需求旺盛，Verisk 盈利超出预期
item.description: Verisk Analytics 周三公布的第一季度利润好于预期，主要原因是财产和意外（P&C）保险公司用于评估保单风险的数据分析产品需求旺盛。【原文：Verisk Analytics reported a better-than-expected profit for the first quarter on Wednesday, driven by demand for its data analytics products primarily used by property and casualty (P&C) insurers to assess policy risks.】

item.title: 独家报道福特以关税为由提高墨西哥生产车型的价格
item.description: 福特汽车公司将从5月2日起提高其在墨西哥生产的三款车型的价格，成为继美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收关税后首批调整贴纸价格的主要汽车制造商之一。【原文：Ford Motor is hiking prices on three of its Mexico-produced models effective May 2, becoming one of the first major automakers to adjust sticker prices following U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs.】
